workout_file.description: Foundation training: Relatively low intensity ride with goal of spending a large proportion of the ride into Endurance Zone 2.
workout_file.name: Week 2.3 - Foundation

textevent.message: Welcome back to another Foundation workout in the Beginner FTP Builder! Let's get started with a progressive warmup.
Remember, the goal of these Foundation days is the maximize our time spent in zone 2, AKA Endurance zone.
We'll also be using a high cadence today during the intervals of between 90-100 RPM.
This faster cadence will use more of your slow-twitch muscle fibers as it decreases the force requirement.
Today's intervals are also going to be slightly longer in duration, and up to 6mins.
We'll stick with the same 2mins rest in between though :-)
That's halfway through the warmup. Keep those legs turning over and shake out the upper body if you're tense.
Is your fan on? Do you have your bottle and towel in reach? You're ready to go then!
1min to go, then we'll get into our zone 2 intervals.
Remember, today we're aiming for 6mins work, with 2mins recovery, 6 times.
All right, start bringing your cadence up a bit here and aim for 90-100 RPM for this entire interval.
Here we go with our first work interval. Bring your cadence up and settle into the rhythm.
Good work so far. Remember, I don't want any bouncing or lurching at this high RPM, stay solid here.
That's halfway through! So far, so good? This intensity should feel more than doable for you.
It's the cadence that might be the challenging part today. Keep those legs spinning :-)
The final minute of our first interval. Great work!
Don't let that cadence drop now. Keep those legs spinning quickly to the arch.
Great! That's 1 down and 5 more to go. Let's take 2mins nice and easy now and spin the legs out.
Make sure you're drinking during the rest periods. Keeping hydrated is vital!
All right, let's get those legs spinning up again for round 2! This time we're starting at 90 RPM.
Leg speed up just a touch here. I want to alternate 90 RPM and 100 RPM each minute for this interval.
Get ready for 100 RPM in 10sec.
Even faster cadence now. Don't lose your form, though, or get sloppy here.
And back down to 90 RPM again, was that 100 RPM minute tough? If so, practice makes perfect!
Back up to 100 RPM again! This is halfway through this 2nd interval.
Slowly bring the cadence down to 90 RPM again, 2mins to go!
Fast feet for this final minute! Spin those legs!
Keep the cadence up to the arch!
Excellent work! Getting accustomed to spinning quickly is an excellent thing to practice. 2mins rest again now.
30sec, and we're working again! Next up, we'll do a progressive cadence interval, starting at 90 RPM.
All right, let's start at 90 RPM for these first 2mins. Steady as you go here.
Next up, we're going to lift the cadence slightly to 95 RPM.
Give me a little more leg speed now, but keep your form solid here.
Our last step is going to be at 100 RPM, and we'll start that in 30sec.
Here we go, FAST FEET!
Keep your hips planted on the saddle, no bouncing here.
30sec left! Keep that cadence up!
Good job! Hopefully, you're starting to feel a bit more comfortable at the higher cadence ranges today.
1 more minute easy peasy, take a few sips of fluid here.
Next up, we're going to aim for a steady 90-100 RPM for the entire interval again.
Bring your cadence up and settle into the rhythm early on here. That should be easy by now.
Good work so far. Remember, I don't want any bouncing or lurching at this high RPM, stay solid here.
That's halfway through! So far, so good? This intensity should feel more than doable for you.
The final minute of our first interval. Great work!
Don't let that cadence drop now. Keep those legs spinning quickly to the arch.
Sweet deal! That makes 4 down with only 2 to go, and then we're DONE. Let's take 2mins easy again here.
All right, our 5th interval is going to involve alternating between 90 and 100 RPM again.
Keep that form solid here!
Leg speed up just a touch here. I want to alternate 90 RPM and 100 RPM each minute for this interval.
Get ready for 100 RPM in 10sec.
Even faster cadence now. Don't lose your form, though, or get sloppy here.
And back down to 90 RPM again, was that 100 RPM minute tough? If so, practice makes perfect!
Back up to 100 RPM again! This is halfway through this 2nd interval.
Slowly bring the cadence down to 90 RPM again, 2mins to go!
Fast feet for this final minute! Spin those legs!
Keep the cadence up to the arch!
Great effort today! We only have 1 more interval left today :-)
All right, our last interval is going to progressively increase the cadence again, every 2mins.
Here we go!
All right, let's start at 90 RPM for these first 2mins. Steady as you go here.
Next up, we're going to lift the cadence slightly to 95 RPM.
Give me a little more leg speed now, but keep your form solid here.
Our last step is going to be at 100 RPM, and we'll start that in 30sec.
Here we go, FAST FEET!
Keep your hips planted on the saddle, no bouncing here.
30sec left! Keep that cadence up!
Excellent work today and way to improve your ability to spin the legs!
All we have left is a 5min easy cooldown. Spin the legs comfortably here.
Be sure to start the recovery process after today as soon as possible.
Even though it was low intensity, refueling is essential.
See you next time :-)
